Subject: RE: [rest-discuss] RE: New REST framework for Java

Nic James Ferrier wrote:
> "Mike Schinkel" <mikeschinkel@...>writes:
> 
> > I have no problem with sharing ideas. But just as Roy
> > Fielding does not believe it is a good thing for a GET
> > to change state, I do not believe it is a good thing to
> > have lots of libraries and frameworks offered with what
> > amounts to arbitrarily differences. I think it should
> > be a best practice to have *consideration* for prior
> > art and not to duplicate prior art if there are no
> > obvious benefits.  I think the unnecessary
> > fragmentation of libraries and frameworks holds back
> > progress.
> > 
> The trouble is, we're in the early days of REST
> frameworks. You expect to see some proliferation before
> consolidation.
> 
> The market (in it's abstract sense rather than it's
> specific monetary form) will sort it out.

You are probably completely right.  

It's just I've been through so damn many of these cycles and seen so many
errors already that I'm hoping we can follow Otto von Bismarck's lead, not
George W. Bush's. :)

-- 
-Mike Schinkel
